text: motor vehicles spot lamps and auxiliary lamps amend rsa ii to read as follows except as provided in paragraph any motor vehicle may be equipped with not to exceed auxiliary driving lamps mounted on the front at a height not less than inches nor more than inches above the level surface upon which the vehicle stands with such measurements to be made from the ground to the center of the lens except that vehicles while used in the winter maintenance of ways may be driven with auxiliary head lamps higher than inches above the surface upon which the vehicle stands provided such head lamps shall be aimed so that the top of the beam of light produced by these head lamps does not exceed the height of a horizontal line which is inches high at a distance of feet ahead of the head lamps of said vehicle motorcycles as defined in rsa may be equipped with not to exceed auxiliary driving lamps mounted on the front of the motorcycle at a height of not more than inches above the level surface upon which the motorcycle stands with such measurements to be made from the ground to the center of the lens new subparagraph traffic safety commission amend rsa i a by inserting after subparagraph the following new subparagraph one representative of the new hampshire motorcyclists rights organization
